intro: Galactophora, commonly known as the moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, round berries that turn red when ripe, containing the seeds. Galactophora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to bloom in low-light conditions. Its botanical features make it a unique and intriguing species within the Solanaceae family.
